According to this [article](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-017-07291-9), *TP53* is the most popular gene in the human genome.
We will look into it from multiple perspectives.

## Data description
We collected harmonized data from the [XenaBrowser]() and [Ensembl]().
- XenaBrowser:
  - Gene expression (FPKM)
  - Exon expression (FPKM)
  - Gene methylation (beta values)
  - Mutations
- Ensembl:
  - orthologues aminoacid alignment
